üõ†Ô∏è Creating Custom Symbolic Functions#

Featuristic supports a rich set of built-in symbolic functions (e.g., add, log, sqrt, sin), but you can easily define and register your own.

This allows you to inject domain knowledge, constrain the search space, or explore creative transformations that go beyond generic math.

üß± What Is a Symbolic Function?#

A symbolic function is a mathematical operator that can be used to build symbolic expressions. Each one has:

  • A name (str)

  • An arity (number of arguments)

  • A format string (how to render the expression)

  • A callable (NumPy/pandas-compatible implementation)

‚úçÔ∏è Defining a Custom Function#

Use define_symbolic_function() to define your own:

from featuristic import define_symbolic_function

# Define a safe inverse transformation
inv = define_symbolic_function(
    name="inv",
    arity=1,
    format_str="1/({})",
    func=lambda x: 1 / (x + 1e-5)
)

  • name: How the function will be identified internally

  • arity: Number of arguments the function takes

  • format_str: How it appears in the rendered formula ({} for each argument)

  • func: A NumPy-compatible function that operates on arrays or Series

‚úÖ Using It in FeatureSynthesis#

Once defined, pass the function to your synthesis instance:

efs = FeatureSynthesis(
    custom_functions=[inv],
    num_features=5,
    max_generations=30
)

Custom functions can be combined with built-in ones, or you can restrict your search space by only using the functions you specify.

üì¶ Example: Clipped Log Function#

Here‚Äôs an example that avoids domain errors by clipping small values:

safe_log = define_symbolic_function(
    name="log1p_clip",
    arity=1,
    format_str="log1p_clip({})",
    func=lambda x: np.log1p(np.clip(x, 1e-5, None))
)

efs = FeatureSynthesis(custom_functions=[safe_log])

üîç Tips for Writing Safe Functions#

Symbolic functions may be evaluated on raw, messy data. To avoid NaN, inf, or crashes:

  • Use np.clip, np.where, or .replace() to handle edge cases

  • Avoid division by zero

  • Always test your function on arrays and pandas.Series

üß† Advanced: Pre-registering Functions#

You can also globally register your function using the @register_symbolic_function decorator:

from featuristic import register_symbolic_function

@register_symbolic_function(name="cube_root", arity=1, fmt="cbrt({})")
def cube_root(x):
    return np.cbrt(x)

Now ‚Äúcube_root‚Äù is available globally via:

FeatureSynthesis(functions=["cube_root"])

üìÉ Built-in Examples#

Name

Arity

Description

add

2

Addition

subtract

2

Subtraction

multiply

2

Multiplication

divide

2

Safe division with fallback

log

1

Safe log with clipping

sin, cos, sqrt

1

Standard math functions

clip

3

Bounded transformation

square, cube

1

Power transforms

Use featuristic.list_symbolic_functions() to see available ones.

‚úÖ Summary#

Concept

Description

define_symbolic_function()

Define symbolic ops dynamically

custom_functions=[...]

Add your own functions to synthesis

format_str

Controls how expressions are rendered

@register_symbolic_function

Register global reusable ops
